articles.title: Nvidia’s stock is no longer the S&P 500’s top gainer this year. Here’s what is.
articles.summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has surpassed Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) as the S&P 500's top-performing stock year-to-date, marking a shift in investor focus beyond semiconductor stocks. This indicates that investors are finding alternative ways to capitalize on the artificial intelligence trend, specifically in nuclear-energy plays. Vistra, an electricity provider, has achieved this impressive feat by offering another avenue for AI and data-center boom investments.

articles.title: Top 10 Nvidia Competitors & Alternatives
articles.summary: This article lists the top 10 competitors and alternatives to Nvidia, a leading manufacturer of GPUs and chips. It details each company's origins, revenue, employee count, and specific competitive advantages or areas of direct competition with Nvidia. The article highlights key players like AMD, Intel, TSMC, and Samsung, emphasizing their roles in the semiconductor and graphics processing markets.

articles.title: SLB, NVIDIA Developing Gen AI Solutions for Energy
articles.summary: SLB announced an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA to develop generative AI solutions specifically for the energy industry, leveraging NVIDIA NeMo. This partnership aims to integrate custom generative AI models into SLB's Delfi and Lumi digital platforms to optimize operations, enhance efficiency, and reduce carbon footprints. Both companies emphasize the transformative potential of AI in the energy sector for exploration, production, and fostering clean energy innovations.

articles.title: Spotlight: SLB and NVIDIA Collaborate on Generative AI Solutions for Energy
articles.summary: SLB and NVIDIA are expanding their long-standing collaboration to develop and deploy generative AI solutions specifically for the energy industry. This partnership leverages NVIDIA NeMo and AI Enterprise to create custom generative AI models, including a seismic foundation model and a coding co-pilot, aimed at improving exploration, production, and delivery of energy resources while driving lower carbon outcomes. The initiative seeks to empower energy domain experts with new ways to interact with complex technical processes and accelerate decision-making through enterprise-scale AI deployments.

articles.title: SLB and NVIDIA collaborate to develop generative AI solutions for the energy sector
articles.summary: SLB and NVIDIA are expanding their collaboration to develop generative AI solutions tailored for the energy industry. This partnership aims to accelerate the deployment of industry-specific AI foundation models across SLB’s digital platforms by leveraging NVIDIA NeMo. The goal is to optimize operations, enhance efficiency, and minimize environmental impact in subsurface exploration, production operations, and data management.

articles.title: Interview: How SLB and NVIDIA are Connecting the Dots between AI and Energy
articles.summary: SLB and NVIDIA have a long-standing collaboration, initially focusing on subsurface imaging using NVIDIA GPUs to process vast amounts of data for the energy industry. Their partnership has expanded to include reservoir simulation workflows, advanced data visualization, and immersive data visualization solutions for digital twins of energy operations. Most recently, they are jointly developing generative AI solutions, leveraging SLB's data and NVIDIA's NeMo™ platform, with plans to make these AI models and platforms accessible to energy sector customers.

articles.title: 3 of Joel Greenblatt’s Top 5 Stocks Are S&P 500 ETFs. These Are the 2 Stocks That Aren’t
articles.summary: Joel Greenblatt, known for "The Little Book That Beat the Market," runs Gotham Asset Management, which holds over 1,400 stocks. While three of his top five holdings are S&P 500 ETFs, the remaining two are mega-cap stocks Nvidia and Microsoft. Greenblatt has notably increased his positions in both NVDA and MSFT, despite some other investors reducing their stakes, demonstrating a contrarian value investing approach.

articles.title: Nvidia’s stock is no longer the S&P 500’s top gainer this year. Here’s what is.
articles.summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has surpassed Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) to become the top-performing stock in the S&P 500 year-to-date. This shift indicates investors are broadening their focus beyond semiconductor companies to other sectors, such as nuclear energy, to capitalize on the AI and data-center booms. Vistra's rise highlights the growing interest in alternative ways to play the artificial intelligence trend.

articles.title: Iris Energy Limited completes its pivot from bitcoin mining to artificial intelligence
articles.summary: Iris Energy Limited (NASDAQ: IREN) is transitioning from Bitcoin mining to artificial intelligence by significantly investing in NVIDIA H200 GPUs for its AI Cloud Services division. The company aims for AI Cloud Services to contribute 10% of its earnings by year-end, leveraging its existing renewable energy infrastructure, which also continues to support Bitcoin mining operations. This pivot is a strategic move to diversify revenue streams, future-proof its business model against cryptocurrency market volatility, and capitalize on the booming AI sector.

articles.title: AI & Data Centers Provide Fuel for Chip Stocks Rally
articles.summary: Semiconductor stocks are expected to continue their rally, fueled by the persistent growth in artificial intelligence (AI) and data center investments. A Bain report highlights "unprecedented levels of investment" in technological infrastructure, with data center costs potentially soaring to $10 billion-$25 billion in five years. This trend is already benefiting companies like Nvidia, and leveraged ETFs offer avenues for traders to capitalize on these movements.

articles.title: T-Mobile Announces Technology Partnership with NVIDIA, Ericsson and Nokia to Advance the Future of Mobile Networking with AI at the Center
articles.summary: T-Mobile announced a collaboration with NVIDIA, Ericsson, and Nokia to advance mobile networking with AI at its core. This partnership involves establishing an AI-RAN Innovation Center in Bellevue, Washington, focused on leveraging AI to enhance 5G networks, improve customer experiences, and unlock new economic opportunities. The initiative aims to revolutionize radio access networks (RAN) by combining 5G Advanced with AI to deliver faster speeds, lower latency, and increased reliability while also supporting third-party AI application workloads at the network edge.

articles.title: EXL launches specialized Insurance Large Language Model (LLM) leveraging NVIDIA AI Enterprise
articles.summary: EXL has launched the EXL Insurance LLM, an industry-specific large language model tailored for critical claims and underwriting tasks within the insurance sector. This specialized LLM, built leveraging NVIDIA AI Enterprise, reportedly achieves a 30% improvement in accuracy on insurance tasks compared to leading general LLMs while also offering 30% lower costs. It addresses the challenges faced by insurers using generic AI by incorporating EXL's deep domain knowledge and proprietary data to enhance precision and regulatory compliance.

articles.title: TSMC and Cadence Collaborate to Deliver AI-Driven Advanced-Node Design Flows, Silicon-Proven IP and 3D-IC Solutions
articles.summary: TSMC and Cadence announced an expanded collaboration to deliver AI-driven advanced-node design flows, silicon-proven IP, and 3D-IC solutions. This partnership focuses on optimizing productivity and performance for AI-driven designs, supporting TSMC's latest process technologies like N3, N2P, and A16, and enabling sophisticated 3D-IC solutions for complex data processing. The collaboration aims to accelerate time to market and enhance silicon performance for the rapidly growing demands of AI applications.

articles.title: NetApp Powers the Future of AI with Intelligent Data Infrastructure
articles.summary: NetApp announced new developments in its collaboration with industry leaders to accelerate AI innovation, providing the intelligent data infrastructure required for GenAI. Key innovations include NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD Storage Certification for NetApp ONTAP, a global metadata namespace, directly integrated AI data pipeline, and a disaggregated storage architecture. NetApp is also expanding its ecosystem collaborations with companies like Domino Data Labs and Lenovo to further integrate and optimize AI workflows.

articles.title: SES AI Collaborates with NVIDIA, Crusoe, and Supermicro on AI for Science Initiative to Accelerate Material Discovery in Electric Transportation
articles.summary: SES AI Corporation has partnered with NVIDIA, Crusoe, and Supermicro on an AI for Science initiative aimed at accelerating material discovery in electric transportation, particularly for Li-Metal batteries. This collaboration leverages cutting-edge AI cloud platforms and sustainable computing infrastructure to map the molecular universe, revolutionize battery chemistry, and enhance energy storage solutions. The project involves generating a comprehensive molecular database, building advanced generative and multimodal large language models, and conducting rigorous laboratory testing of promising candidates to drive breakthroughs in battery technology for EVs and UAMs.

articles.title: Micron rises 13% as strong forecast impresses AI-hungry investors
articles.summary: Micron Technology's shares jumped over 13% after its strong first-quarter revenue forecast indicated high demand and favorable pricing for HBM chips used in AI. The company's forecast and impressive quarterly revenue growth, exceeding Wall Street estimates, suggest a robust market for memory chips, despite earlier concerns about HBM pricing. This positive outlook also influenced other chip firms, though some gains were pared due to news of a U.S. Department of Justice probe into Super Micro Computer.

articles.title: Why Optical Interposers Are The Hidden But Essential Component For The AI Revolution
articles.summary: Optical interposers are becoming crucial for the AI revolution due to the escalating demand for faster, more efficient data transfer that traditional electronics cannot meet. These components, combining electronic and photonic chips, significantly reduce power consumption and improve connectivity, making them essential for future AI infrastructure and hyperscale data centers. Companies like POET Technologies are already developing advanced optical interposer platforms to address these industry needs.

articles.title: Up 6%, What's Next For Applied Materials Stock?
articles.summary: Applied Materials stock recently gained 6% and is up 22% year-to-date, driven by a Fed interest rate cut, an upswing in the semiconductor cycle, and robust demand from the AI sector. The company's Q3 2024 results exceeded expectations, with revenue growth and strong earnings, and it is guiding for continued growth in Q4 FY’24 despite risks from U.S. restrictions on semiconductor exports to China. Forbes values Applied Materials stock at $222 per share, indicating a potential 10% upside from the current market price.

articles.title: P&G: Bio-AI for Enhanced Cold Water Cleaning
articles.summary: Procter & Gamble has partnered with bio-AI start-up Basecamp Research to improve cold water laundry performance. This collaboration aims to develop new enzymes that work efficiently in cold temperatures, leveraging Basecamp Research's AI platform and genetic biodiversity data. The initiative supports P&G's sustainability goals, including their net zero emissions target by 2040, by enabling consumers to reduce energy consumption and lengthen clothing lifespan through cold water washing.

articles.title: Should Motley Fool 100 Index ETF (TMFC) Be on Your Investing Radar?
articles.summary: The Motley Fool 100 Index ETF (TMFC) is highlighted as a suitable option for investors seeking exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, especially given its strong performance and Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy). The article details its expense ratio, sector allocation, top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, and compares it to alternative ETFs such as Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) and Invesco QQQ (QQQ). Investors are encouraged to consider TMFC's attributes alongside its risk and performance metrics for long-term investment strategies.

articles.title: Two major catalysts coming in October! Goldman Sachs recommends buying call options on Tesla.
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs recommends buying call options on Tesla (TSLA.US) ahead of two significant October events: the Q3 earnings report on October 2 and the Robotaxi event on October 10. Tesla's options trading accounts for 17% of total S&P 500 options, surpassing Nvidia, and analysts anticipate meeting Q3 earnings expectations with strong growth from the China market.

articles.title: AI Mania in Fine Fettle: ETFs to Invest
articles.summary: The article discusses the resurgence of AI investment fervor on Wall Street, driven by strong performances from companies like Micron and significant investments from tech giants such as Microsoft and Amazon. It highlights how these developments are boosting the AI sector and suggests several AI-focused ETFs, including BOTZ, ROBT, and WISE, for investors looking to capitalize on this trend. The piece also touches upon NVIDIA's fluctuating valuation and its central role in the AI infrastructure.

articles.title: 3 Great ETFs for Jittery Markets
articles.summary: As markets show signs of instability after a bull run, investors may seek more stable performance than broad market index ETFs. This article highlights three ETFs—iShares MSCI USA Min Vol Factor ETF (USMV), JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI), and Schwab Short-Term U.S. Treasury ETF (SCHO)—designed to reduce volatility and preserve capital. These ETFs offer strategies ranging from low-volatility equity exposure to income generation and short-term Treasury investments to help smooth returns for cautious investors.

articles.title: Nokia Gains Big with CoreWeave’s AI Networking Deal
articles.summary: Nokia has secured a significant deal with AI-focused cloud provider CoreWeave for its global backbone's optical and IP transport networking. This win strengthens Nokia's position in the competitive AI networking market, highlighting its ability to provide high performance and energy efficiency. The partnership is crucial for Nokia's credibility given CoreWeave's leadership in GPU-driven AI workloads and substantial funding.

articles.title: Hedge Funds Load Up on Tech Stocks Ahead of Rate Cuts
articles.summary: Hedge funds are increasing their long positions in technology stocks, anticipating interest rate cuts will boost consumer spending and corporate investment in areas like AI. The article highlights opportunities in broader tech, semiconductors, and AI-specific ETFs for traders looking to align with this trend.

articles.title: T-Mobile targets $10 billion EBITDA rise by 2027
articles.summary: T-Mobile US, Inc. announced a three-year growth strategy aiming for a nearly $10 billion increase in annual Core Adjusted EBITDA by 2027, alongside significant service revenue growth and improved free cash flow. The company plans to leverage advancements in 5G technology, AI-driven customer service, and strategic partnerships to expand its market share and enhance shareholder returns, including a 35% increase in its quarterly cash dividend. These initiatives build on strong financial performance and positive analyst outlooks, despite a recent fine.

articles.title: Lisa Su on AMD’s Strategy for Growth and the Future of AI
articles.summary: Lisa Su, CEO and chair of AMD, discusses the company's growth strategy, focusing on its strong position in high-performance computing and pervasive AI. She highlights AMD's successful acquisitions and partnerships, its latest MI300X AI chip often compared to its competitor Nvidia's, and addresses the "AI bubble" skeptics by emphasizing AI's transformative potential over the next five years. Su also touches on geopolitical considerations, and the importance of increasing women's leadership in the tech industry.

articles.title: Intel and AWS Expand Strategic Collaboration, Helping Advance U.S.-Based Chip Manufacturing
articles.summary: Intel and AWS announced a significant expansion of their strategic collaboration, involving a multi-year, multi-billion-dollar co-investment in custom chip designs. Intel will produce an AI fabric chip on Intel 18A and a custom Xeon 6 chip on Intel 3 for AWS, accelerating U.S.-based semiconductor manufacturing and fostering a vibrant AI ecosystem in Ohio.

articles.title: Capturing the in vogue ‘mega-forces’ in a one-stop ETF shop
articles.summary: The iShares Global 100 ETF (IOO) was recognized as the top ETF Product at the 2024 Financial Newswire/SQM Research Fund Manager of the Year Awards. This BlackRock fund specifically targets top-performing global companies, focusing on those with diversified revenue streams and large market caps, moving beyond simple index tracking. It has a strong track record of capitalizing on prevailing mega-trends like technology and AI, demonstrating consistent performance in capturing global economic transformers.

articles.title: Byrna Technologies (BYRN) Softened in Q2 Due to Low Trading Volumes
articles.summary: Byrna Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: BYRN) saw its stock price soften in Q2 2024, despite strong fundamentals, primarily due to low trading volumes, leading Meridian Small Cap Growth Fund to trim its position. The company, a non-lethal self-defense technology provider, reported Q2 revenue of $20.3 million, up 76% year-over-year. Although acknowledging BYRN's potential, Meridian Funds emphasized a greater conviction in AI stocks for higher short-term returns.

articles.title: PayMate to acquire DigiAsia in $400 million deal
articles.summary: PayMate India, a B2B payments company, announced an agreement to acquire Singapore-based Fintech-as-a-Service provider DigiAsia Bios Pte Ltd. for $400 million, with an additional $25 million investment planned post-acquisition. This strategic move aims to expand PayMate's market share in Indonesia and precedes its planned public listing in 2025. DigiAsia's parent company, DIGIASIA Corp. (NASDAQ: FAAS), has also recently secured a significant allocation of NVIDIA H200 GPUs to bolster its AI fintech solutions, despite facing high stock volatility and a significant decline over the past year.

articles.title: 3 Of the Best ETFs to Buy for AI Stocks Exposure
articles.summary: This article recommends three top AI ETFs for investors looking to gain exposure to the artificial intelligence boom at a lower cost than individual stocks. It highlights the Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (BOTZ), ROBO Global Artificial Intelligence ETF (THNQ), and First Trust NASDAQ AI and Robotics ETF (ROBT), detailing their holdings, expense ratios, and investment strategies. The author also provides a tactical recommendation for buying THNQ during a pullback.
